intro: Epidendrum bourgeaui, commonly known as the Bourgeau's Epidendrum, is a species of orchid native to Central America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces clusters of fragrant, showy flowers in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, exhibiting an epiphytic lifestyle. Its leaves are革质 (leathery) and arranged in a rosette pattern, aiding in water retention. The flowers bloom during the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
